Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
clipboard
<operating system> A temporary memory area, used to transfer information within a document being edited or between documents or between programs. The fundamental operations are "cut" which moves data from a document to the clipboard, "copy" which copies it to the clipboard, and "paste" which inserts the clipboard contents into the current document in place of the current selection.
Different {Graphical User Interfaces} vary in how they handle the different types of data which a user might want to transfer via the clipboard, some (e.g. the {X Window System}) support only plain text, others (e.g. {NEXTSTEP}) support arbitrarily typed data.
(1996-08-23)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: clipboard \clipboard\ n. a small writing board with a clip attached at the top for holding papers. [WordNet 1.5]
clipboard n : a small writing board with a clip at the top for holding papers
